raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you today?
User: Great
System: That's great to hear! :)
User: I'm thinking of buying some stocks, do you have any tips?
System: What kind of stocks are you thinking about?
User: Technology
System: Hmm.. I have no experience with that. Sorry!
User: That's okay. What's your favorite software company?
System: I'm not very educated about stocks. But I do know that Nintendo is a good one.
User: I can also sell stocks, which ones shall I sell?
System: The ones that are in the red.
User: any particular stocks to sell?
System: Sell whatever seems like it would be the most profitable.
User: Depends on the election
System: Well, I haven't thought that far ahead.
User: when is the election?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hello, Nice to meet you
System: If you could eat only one food for the rest of time, what would it be?
User: Hmm... That's a tough one. I think I would go Asian Food > Chinese Food > Stirfry. What about you?
System: I think ice-cream. It may not be good for me, but I wouldn't care, haha
User: I love ice cream too!
System: Okay, top three flavors?
User: I like vanilla more than chocolate ice cream. I typically will do any variations on vanilla. To pick from the top of my head, I would say Cookies and Cream, Mint Chocolate Chip, and Coffee. How about you?
System: Ah, that's a good way of framing it. Me, I like berries: boysenberry one, strawberry two, maybe straight chocolate number 3 to mix it up a bit.
User: Very nice. I love sorbet's and smoothies. Changing topics, Do you believe in an afterlife?
System: Yes. I wonder if I'm in it right now. How would I know? What do you think?
User: I think so. I feel there must be something more than the physical world as we understand it.
System: There's a mental world, I suppose? Understanding itself
User: What is the most supernatural experience you have ever had?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What are you up to this evening?
System: I am talking to you on the internet.
User: What would you like to talk about?
System: My favourite subjects are anything but especially games and football.
User: Do you like chess?
System: Yes I love it. Let's play. Pawn to K4.
User: Haha sure sure. Pawn to C5
System: I'm just joking with you. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do.
User: Oh yeah? Which computers are those?
System: That's interesting. That's alright. Any computer, as long as it is programmed correctly.
User: Ok, so how do you program a computer correctly so it can play chess?
System: Use good algorithms and data structures. Alright then.
User: What kind of algorithms are those?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: That's interesting, but I don't see what that has to do with chess.

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What is your favorite holiday?
User: one where I get to meet lots of different people.
System: What was the most number of people you have ever met during a holiday?
User: Hard to keep a count. Maybe 25.
System: Which holiday was that?
User: I think it was Australia
System: Do you still talk to the people you met?
User: Not really. The interactions are usually short-lived but it's fascinating to learn where people are coming from and what matters to them

Sample5:

Conversation History:

System: Life is great! :)
User: what are you most passionate about?
System: I'm passionate about making people smile! :)
User: haha, everyone needs that!

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey!
User: How's your day going?
System: Having fun, but have a bit of a headache How about you?
User: I'm good! Just getting ready to watch a basketball game. Hope your headache goes away!
System: Haha, thanks! Never get them, so it's super weird Who's playing?
User: Hmm, try taking some REDACTED_TERM! I'm going to see the Warriors vs. the Grizzlies. Ever see them play?
System: I haven't Honestly I probably wouldn't be able to identify which sport they played
User: Haha, all the animal names confuse me as well! Who came up with these naming conventions? I'd name my team something more original: The New York Chairs!
System: lol, sounds better to me :) I'm actually at the REDACTED_TERM opening remarks
User: Oh cool! What is "NeurIPS"?
System: Neural Information Processing Systems
User: Oh wow! Sounds fancy! What is that about?
System: It's the biggest ML conference in the world
User: Oh, ML?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! How's it going?
User: Hi, how are you?
System: I'm doing well, thank you. How are you?
User: I'm fine. What's up?
System: Not much. How about you?
User: nothing new. Anything exciting happening recently?
System: Not really. You?
User: I watched a movie recently which was pretty good
System: That's good. What movie?
User: the irishman, have you seen it?
System: I have not. Should I?
User: I think so
System: Alright, I'll put it on my watch list.
User: How about you? Have you watched anything interesting recently?
System: I've been waiting to see the new Star Trek movie.
User: what is it about?
System: The adventures of Kirk, Spock, and McCoy.
User: when was it released?
System: It just came out today.
User: are you sure, I think it's been out for a while
System: I'm positive. I know because I just watched it.
User: well, the fact you just watched it doesn't mean it was released today
System: That's what I said, I did watch it today.
User: ok, I'll put it on my watchlist
System: Let me know what you think of it when you watch it.
User: sure, I need to go, nice talking to you

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello
User: how is the youtube video creation going?
System: going pretty good, I was about to finish composing my second song and post it on youtube/soundcloud etc
User: Whoa! Looking forward to listening to it. What softewares you use for it?
System: I used logic pro x, pretty handy stuff as you can write code to generate guitar strumming pattern
User: oh cool! What sort of music do you compose?
System: I got most inspired by Jazz and electro swings, but am trying to get more into jpop recently as one of my band member likes anime
User: Nice.... you are a rockstar! ;)
System: haha thanks, do you plan any instruments?
User: Yeah.... I play bit of guitar. Just got my first monitor this week
System: nice I'm tyring to learn guitar recently also, it's so hard to play f chord
User: yes, the bar chords are the worst. It took me several months to play them well. I still can't play them for a long time though

Sample9:

System: Hi there.

System: I like to fly aeroplanes

User: I mostly fly Cessna 172s.
System: What's the farthest you've flown?
User: About 150 miles each way.

Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?

- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.
